docs.text: while watching boiler room , i was constantly reminded of last year's masterpiece fight club .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both films consist of a predominately male cast .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both films follow young men as they illicitly fight the traditional system for their own desires .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and both films are seen through the eyes of one narrator , who eventually realizes that these men have to be stopped .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while boiler room writer/director ben younger does not get his point across as well as david fincher does for fight club , he does contribute another impressive work to a series of films aiming to represent the new generation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a generation which has seen the internet prosper and where everyone wants to be a millionaire .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: paying homage to oliver stone's 1987 classic wall street , younger is almost modernizing the tale by using younger , hipper actors to play the greedy villains as opposed to the older , more experienced types .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as is true in real life , younger minds are becoming richer and richer from their knowledge of more standard technology .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: boiler room dismisses the notion of ingenuity and shows that greed and desire for power come in all ages .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another similarity with fight club is that both films are not action flicks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some people are convinced that an all-male cast automatically means there must be gory violence , here is proof that this is not true .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you want to see an action movie starring ben affleck , go see reindeer games this weekend .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you want to see a smart , insightful film with excellent acting and a clever script , see boiler room .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: giovanni ribisi gives an outstanding performance as the film's narrator , seth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after dropping out of college and running a lucrative gambling center for college students in his apartment , seth is offered a high paying job by a wealthy man ( nicky katt ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he agrees to take the job ( in which you are guaranteed to become a millionaire within three years ) of selling stock to well-off americans from the mid-west over the telephone and begins to fit in quite well with his co-workers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: learning tricky techniques to deceive innocent people into buying shares of a good in production , seth figures this is too good to be true .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after stumbling into a room at the wrong time , he knows there is something no good about this company .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at this point , seth is left with the ultimate choice ; continue with the american dream and make millions or tell the authorities that something fishy is going on .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ribisi is believable as seth especially when he shares scenes with ron rifkin , playing seth's dad .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the two have perfect chemistry as a troubled father and son trying to impress each other and simultaneously impress themselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the transitions from anger to sympathy that these scenes contain are the standout segments of the entire film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the supporting cast of greedy co-workers is also flawless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ben affleck shines in a short but sweet performance as a recruiter for the company , nicky katt is fabulous as the ostensibly friendly boss who eventually becomes extremely jealous of seth , and vin diesel gives his best performance of his career as the foil character of nicky katt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the energy of the cast as a whole makes boiler room well paced and never boring .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only major error in the film is that nothing major happens .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is no big plot twist or climatic point to make the film more memorable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: due to the lack of a major event , boiler room never finds a suitable genre to fit into .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is not intense enough to be a thriller , the romantic segments involving seth and abby ( nia long ) are not properly finalized , and the dialogue isn't funny enough to make it a comedy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in having trouble to characterize the movie as a whole , boiler room is slightly confused at times .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it doesn't seem to know which category to fit itself into .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one satisfying concluding scene could have changed the whole film for the better .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: otherwise , the movie is fun to watch thanks to its lively cast of young actors .
docs.label: positive
